clinical_study.brief_title: Prophylactic Norepinephrine Infusion for Spinal Hypotension and Inferior Vena Cava Collapsibility Index
clinical_study.official_title: Prophylactic Norepinephrine Infusion for Spinal Hypotension and Inferior Vena Cava Collapsibility Index During Cesarean Delivery: a Randomized Double Blinded Controlled Study

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the preventive effect of norepinephrine on post-spinal hypotension and the effect of norepinephrine on inferior vena cava collapsibility index (IVC-CI).

detailed_description.textblock: Post-spinal hypotension is a frequent complication during spinal anesthesia for cesarean delivery. It affects nearly 50-60% of patients without appropriately treat. Vasopressors has been highly recommended for routine prevention and/or treatment of post-spinal hypotension. Norepinephrine is new vasopressor that has been suggested as a potential alternative to phenylephrine and was recently introduced in obstetric anesthesia because of the minimal cardiac depressant effect. The purpose of this study is to investigate the preventive effect of norepinephrine on post-spinal hypotension and the effect on inferior vena cava collapsibility index (IVC-CI).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: SBP decreased to <80% of the baseline value

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of nausea and vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of nausea and vomiting in patients after subarachnoid block
Systolic blood pressure at or above 120% of baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial base excess of fetal vein blood
Pressure of oxygen of fetal vein blood
pH value of fetal vein blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately to 20 minutes after subarachnoid block
secondary_outcome.description: a bolus of norepinephrine was given when SBP decreased to <80% of the baseline value
A= Appearance P=Pulse G=Grimace A=Attitude R=Respiration
A= Appearance P=Pulse G=Grimace A=Attitude R=Respiration
A= Appearance P=Pulse G=Grimace A=Attitude R=Respiration

arm_group.description: Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of normal saline was given followed by normal saline infusion
Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of norepinephrine was given followed by norepinephrine infusion

intervention.description: a bolus of normal saline was given followed by normal saline infusion
a bolus of norepinephrine was given followed by norepinephrine infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-45 years
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification I to II
- Scheduled for elective cesarean delivery under spinal anesthesia
- Full-term, singleton, pregnant women
Exclusion Criteria:
- Height of no more than 150 centimeters
- Body weight greater than 100 kg or BMI greater than 30
- Labor analgesia had been performed
- Contraindication of spinal or epidural anesthesia
- Eclampsia or chronic hypertension or baseline blood pressure ≥160mmHg
- Hemoglobin ＜7g/dl
- Fetal distress or known abnormal fetal development
- Severe vascular disease
- Diabetes mellitus or cardiovascular disease or nervous system disease

facility.name: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University
